User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9

Upon opening firefox, the icons/buttons for addons that I have added to my toolbars are often not present.  The stumbleupon toolbar also appears on its own line (the default behavior) instead of where I have placed it on the far right side of the bookmarks bar.  When I right click on a toolbar and choose "Customize..." the icons/buttons that are associated with my addons do not appear in the list - only the default firefox buttons (separator, print, zoom, etc) are listed.  In addition, the stumbleupon toolbar disappears when the customize toolbar menu is open, leaving instead a blank line of toolbar.

I have been able to temporarily solve this problem several times by disabling addons that are marked as incompatible with firefox 4 (for example skipscreen and add to search bar).  Once firefox restarts without the addon enabled, the icons reappear in the menu.  However, if I reactivate the addon, the icons are still present in the menu and usually remain where they have been placed in the toolbar and available in the customize toolbar menu for several weeks before disappearing again.  There does not seem to be any specific activity that triggers the disappearance of the icons from the toolbar.

Reproducible: Sometimes

comments.raw_text:
While it is likely possible for an individual addon to cause this problem it does also occur on its own.

In my version of the bug once the icon for an addon disappears it goes away forever, the only fix I've found is to reinstall.


I can confirm that this bug WILL still manifest itself even if only one addon.  I have confirmed this by uninstalling all addons except for one, experiencing the issue for that one addon.  I've reproduced this with several addons.
Addons for which this was reproduced:
https everywhere
disconnect.me
do not track me by abine
lastpass
session manager


One addon seems to be immune, however, adblock plus being one of them that is either immune or more resistant to this bug.


Not only does the addon icon disappear from the toolbar but it also disappears from the right side "open menu" and from the customize area.

The disappearance of the addon icon is accompanied by a partial degradation of the addons' functionality.  For example the lastpass icon links in some username/email and password textboxes in web pages will still show up and when they are clicked the user is presented with the lastpass login dialog, however after completing the login lastpass cannot fill the field and indeed appears as though it were not logged in.

Conversely some functionality of the addons are retained; for example, according to the firefox console, https everywhere appears to still be rewriting urls, and disconnect.me still appears to be blocking certain urls.

LIKELY CAUSE:
I believe this problem is related to a network or DNS issue where firefox can't make one or more network connections or resolve DNS names for one or more addons on startup.

TO REPRODUCE:
You will need Windows 7 or 8.
You will need a socks proxy server or a linux computer with internet access to which you have SSH access and SSH tunneling rights.

Start with a clean firefox install.
Open firefox => "Open Menu" => "Options" => "Network" tab => "Connection" "Settings" button.
Select "Manual proxy configuration:".
Leave HTTP Proxy, SSL Proxy, and FTP Proxy blank with ports of 0.
Put your SOCKS 5 Proxy IP address and Port in "SOCKS Host".
Check "SOCKS v5" and "Remote DNS".
OK your way out and close firefox.

Ensure the Windows Firewall is enabled.
Open "Windows Firewall with Advanced Security".
Select "Outbound Rules".

Click "New Rule" => select "Custom" => "This program path:".
Specify EXACTLY the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe", DO NOT USE a path with variables such as "%ProgramFiles% in it.
Click Next => leave the default of "Protocol type" of "Any" => Click Next.
Leave defaults of "Any IP address" => Click Next.
Leave default of "Block the connection" => Click Next.
Leave Domain, Private, Public checked => Click Next.
Give the rule a name such as "Block firefox".

Click "New Rule" => select "Custom" => "This program path:".
Specify EXACTLY the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe", DO NOT USE a path with variables such as "%ProgramFiles% in it.
Click Next => set "Protocol type" to "TCP" => set "Remote port" to "Specific Ports", enter the TCP port of your SOCKS 5 proxy server => Click Next.
Set "Local IP address" to "Any IP address" => set "Remote IP address" to the IP address of your SOCKS 5 proxy => Click Next.
Check "Allow the connection" => Click Next.
Leave Domain, Private, Public checked => Click Next.
Give the rule a name such as "Allow Firefox to Proxy".

Open firefox and ensure that it can connect to a web site with your proxy server.

Install the addon https everywhere or another addon from the list of addons that permanently fails to load above.
Restart firefox to confirm that you can see the addon icon.
Close firefox.

Go back to Windows Firewall and disable the rule "Allow Firefox to Proxy".
Open firefox, THE ADDON ICON SHOULD BE MISSING and firefox shouldn't be able to connect to any internet sites.
Go back to Windows Firewall and ENABLE the rule "Allow Firefox to Proxy".
Open firefox, THE ADDON ICON SHOULD *STILL* BE MISSING but firefox should now be able to connect to internet sites again.
The missing addon icons should remain missing *permanently*.



This is a *very* annoying bug which can potentially lead to the inability to use firefox (no lastpass, no ability to sign into sites), and privacy leaks (no https everywhere on a public wifi network, etc.).

plink.exe -D DesiredSOCKS5ProxyPort -2 LinuxUsername@LinuxComputerIPAddress
